p: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a broad field encompassing the development of computer systems capable of performing tasks that typically require human intelligence. Machine learning (ML) is a subset of artificial intelligence (AI), and deep learning (DL) is a subfield of ML algorithms and techniques, which immediately entered the field of clinical research [1]. With ML, computers can be trained to learn from data rather than being explicitly programmed, allowing them to improve their performance over time through experience. ML is a computational procedure through which a system is capable of identifying and understanding the input data and, consequently, using the obtained information in decision‐making and prediction of different events [2]. The application of these methods has led to extraordinary results in medical data processing, and they have been remarkably successful in diagnosing various diseases [3]. A major application of ML concerning health is the diagnosis or prognosis of different diseases. Diagnostic or prognostic models can be utilized as a system to support clinical decisions to help clinicians [4]. In addition, they may be used as a model to predict mortality in various diseases [5].
